Author: asdflkj
Content:
I think he is talking about not a "new profession", but new achievements within your profession. Good artists, architects and novelists constantly strive for that.

But startups is not a profession. It's a way to get from "zero" to "financially set for life". If your "profession" is business, then after making millions, you should aim for billions, and another web startup isn't a good way to get there. If you are trying to make something people want, then you can make a much bigger difference without trying to make a profit. Wikipedia and Ubuntu (and YC, for that matter) are good examples of that. If you're trying to be on the cutting edge of tech, research is better than startups.

By the way, J.K. Rowling is not a good author, so it's a bad example.

Content:

Author: DocSavage
Content: It's not clear what are the advantages of BlueprintCSS over Yahoo's YUI Library CSS tools, e.g. the YUI Grids (http://developer.yahoo.com/yui/grids/) and the grid tool. YUI has plenty of documentation and has a lot of eyeballs to test it on different browsers. The Yahoo team size seems like a big advantage of YUI CSS over BlueprintCSS.
